features.description:
Create calculate_gap_with_overlap() method in CMEComplianceService

Add new method in apps/backend-api/src/core/services/cme_compliance_service.py after line 1200:
- Create TopicGap and CMEGapCalculation dataclasses
- Implement overlap logic (max for overlapping topics, additive for separate topics)
- Handle counts_toward_total field from CMERule
- Return structured CMEGapCalculation result

This is the core SSOT method for gap calculations across all endpoints.

Update calculate_compliance() to use calculate_gap_with_overlap()

Refactor apps/backend-api/src/core/services/cme_compliance_service.py line 1306:
- Replace naive subtraction gap calculation
- Call self.calculate_gap_with_overlap() method
- Pass topic_progress and state_rules
- Store CMEGapCalculation result in compliance result

Ensures /check endpoint uses same logic as /harmonize.

Refactor /harmonize endpoint to use calculate_gap_with_overlap()

Update apps/backend-api/src/contexts/cme/api/compliance_endpoints.py lines 675-718:
- Remove duplicate overlap logic from endpoint
- Call service.calculate_gap_with_overlap() instead
- Simplify endpoint code (reduce from 43 lines to ~10 lines)
- Ensure response format unchanged

DRY principle - remove duplicate logic from endpoint layer.

Create comprehensive unit tests for calculate_gap_with_overlap()

Create apps/backend-api/tests/unit/cme/test_gap_calculation.py with tests:
- test_separate_topics_are_additive() - Medical Errors (separate) adds to general gap
- test_overlapping_topics_use_max() - Overlapping topics use max(general_gap, topic_gaps)
- test_mixed_overlap_and_separate() - Combined scenario
- test_dr_sehgal_florida_case() - Real-world case (51h total, 0h Medical Errors, 2h required)
- test_no_topics_simple_subtraction() - Fallback to simple calculation

Target: 100% coverage of calculate_gap_with_overlap() method.

Update CME response schemas to include counts_toward_total field

Update apps/backend-api/src/contexts/cme/schemas/cme_schemas.py:
- Add counts_toward_total: bool field to TopicProgressResponse (default=True)
- Add explanation: Optional[str] field to TopicProgressResponse
- Create TopicGapResponse schema (topic, gap_hours, counts_toward_total, explanation)
- Create CMEGapDetail schema (total_gap, general_gap, overlap_topic_gaps, separate_topic_gaps, calculation_method)
- Add gap_detail: Optional[CMEGapDetail] to CMEComplianceResult

Phase 2: API contract standardization.

Populate counts_toward_total and explanation fields in service responses

Update apps/backend-api/src/core/services/cme_compliance_service.py topic_progress loop (~line 1440):
- Add counts_toward_total field from rule.counts_toward_total
- Generate user-friendly explanation:
  - If gap > 0 and counts_toward_total=True: 'These X.Xh count toward your Yh general CME requirement'
  - If gap > 0 and counts_toward_total=False: 'These X.Xh are IN ADDITION to your Yh general requirement'
- Add explanation field to topic_progress dict

Enables frontend to display overlap badges.

Create integration test for endpoint parity (/harmonize vs /check)

Create apps/backend-api/tests/integration/test_cme_parity.py:
- test_harmonize_check_parity_same_provider() - Call both endpoints, assert gap values match
- test_harmonize_check_parity_multiple_states() - Test across FL, OH, CA
- test_dr_sehgal_florida_gap_is_2h() - Specific test for known case
- Use real provider data from test fixtures
- Assert: harmonize_gap == check_gap (within 0.01h)

Critical: Ensures Single Calculation Service Architecture works.

Remove client-side gap calculation from State Detail page

Update apps/frontend-web/src/app/dashboard/states/[state]/page.tsx:
- Remove useEffect hook that calculates generalCMEGap from topics (~line 85)
- Remove client-side max() logic for overlapping topics
- Use stateData.gap directly from API response
- Update gap display to trust API value
- Remove outdated comment about 'overlap logic'

Phase 3: Frontend refactor - trust API, don't calculate client-side.

Add overlap badges to CME Compliance Table tooltips

Update apps/frontend-web/src/components/dashboard/CMEComplianceTable.tsx:
- Read counts_toward_total field from topic data
- Update topic gap tooltips:
  - If counts_toward_total=true: Show blue badge 'Overlaps with general CME'
  - If counts_toward_total=false: Show orange badge 'Separate requirement (additive)'
- Display explanation text from API if available
- Add visual indicator (icon or colored dot) next to gap hours

Helps users understand why gaps are calculated differently.

Add frontend component test for State Detail page

Create apps/frontend-web/src/app/dashboard/states/__tests__/StatePage.test.tsx:
- Mock API response with counts_toward_total fields
- Render StatePage component
- Assert: Gap displayed matches API response (no client-side calculation)
- Assert: Tooltips show correct overlap badges
- Test scenario: overlapping topic (blue badge) vs separate topic (orange badge)

Ensures frontend correctly displays API data without modification.

Refactor generate_cme_v4.py to call backend API instead of local calculation

Update scripts/generate_cme_v4.py:
- Remove duplicate gap calculation logic (lines with overlap handling)
- Add API client to call /api/v1/cme/compliance/check endpoint
- Use gap value from API response
- Remove local CMERule queries (use API data)
- Add error handling for API failures

Phase 4: Ad-hoc reports must use backend SSOT (ADR-005 compliance).

Create integration test for ad-hoc report parity with API

Update tests/integration/test_adhoc_parity.py:
- Add test_adhoc_report_matches_api() method
- Run generate_cme_v4.py for test provider
- Call /check API for same provider
- Parse report output, extract gap value
- Assert: report_gap == api_gap (within 0.01h)
- Test multiple providers (Dr. Sehgal, test300, test500)

Ensures ad-hoc reports show same gaps as dashboard/API.

Create end-to-end test for Dr. Sehgal Florida consistency

Create apps/backend-api/tests/e2e/test_dr_sehgal_consistency.py:
- test_florida_gap_consistency_across_all_endpoints()
  - Call /harmonize for Dr. Sehgal
  - Call /check for Dr. Sehgal + FL
  - Run generate_cme_v4.py for Dr. Sehgal
  - Parse all three sources, extract FL gap
  - Assert: all three show 2.0h gap (not 4.0h)
- test_ohio_zero_gap_consistency()
  - Same test but for OH license (should be 0.0h gap)

Phase 5: Validation that ADR-006 success criteria met.

Create ADR draft: Refactor /harmonize endpoint to use calculate_gap_with_overlap()

Update apps/ba
